1.text: Am I not sent? am I not free? have I not seen Jesus Christ our Lord? are ye not my work in the Lord.

2.text: If to others I am not sent, but surely I am to you: for the seal of my sending are ye in the Lord.

3.text: My justification to them examining me is this,

4.text: have we not power to eat and to drink?

5.text: Have we not power to lead about a sister, a wife; as also the rest of the sent, and the brethren of the Lord, and Cephas?

6.text: Or I only and Barnabas, have we not power not to work?

7.text: Who makes war at any time at his own charges who plants a vineyard, and eats not of its fruit or who feeds a flock, and eats not of the milk of the flock?

8.text: Not according to man do I speak these things: or does not the law also say these things?

9.text: For in the law of Moses has been written, Thou shalt not muzzle the mouth of the ox grinding. Is there not care to God for oxen?

10.text: Or does he say altogether on account of us? For it was written on account of us: that he ploughing ought to plough upon hope; and he grinding upon hope, to participate with his hope.

11.text: If we have sown to you spiritual things, is it great if we shall reap your carnal things?

12.text: If others participate with your power, not rather we? But we used not this power; but endure all things, lest we give some hindrance to the good news of Christ.

13.text: Do ye not know that they working consecrated things, eat of the temple? they working diligently at the altar, share together with the altar?

14.text: Thus also the Lord appointed to them announcing good news to live of the good news.

15.text: But I used none of these things: and I wrote not these things, that thus it might be with me: for good to me rather to die, than that any should render my boasting void.

16.text: For if I announce the good news, there is no boasting to me: for necessity is laid upon me; and woe is to me, if I announce not the good news!

17.text: For if of free will I do this, I have reward: and if unwillingly, I have been entrusted with a stewardship.

18.text: What reward therefore is to me? That announcing good news, I shall make the good news of Christ not expensive, not to make use of my power in the good news.

19.text: For being free from all, I have subjected myself to all, that I might gain the more.

20.text: And I was to the Jews as a Jew, that I might gain the Jews: to them under the law, as under the law, that I might gain them under the law;

21.text: To the lawless, as lawless, (not being lawless to God, but subject to the law to Christ,) that I might gain the lawless,

22.text: I became to the weak as weak, that I might gain the weak: I have been all things to all, that altogether I might save some.

23.text: And this I do on account of the good news, that I might become a partaker of it.

24.text: Do ye not know that they running in a race-course, all truly run, and one receives the prize of combat? Do ye so run, that ye might receive.

25.text: And every one contending for the prize, has self command in all things. These surely therefore that they might receive a corruptible crown; and we an incorruptible.

26.text: I therefore so run, as not uncertainly; so practise I pugilism, as not laying stripes upon air:

27.text: But I give my body a blow under the eyes, and reduce to bondage: lest having proclaimed to others, I myself be rejected.
